definition: ten lines at a glance (idiom)/to read very rapidly
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
eye/item/section/list/catalogue/table of contents/order (taxonomy)/goal/name/title
ten/10
row/line/commercial firm/line of business/profession/to rank (first, second etc) among one's siblings (by age)/(in data tables) row/(Tw) column

to walk/to go/to travel/a visit/temporary/makeshift/current/in circulation/to do/to perform/capable/competent/effective/all right/OK!/will do/behavior/conduct/Taiwan pr. [xing4] for the behavior-conduct sense

sentences.english: You'd better not race through it, you should pay attention to the details.
sentences.chinese: 你最好別那麼一目十行地看，你該注意一下細節。

sentences.english: Be read rapidly at that time, very nervous very successful also feeling.
sentences.chinese: 這時候是一目十行的，很緊張也很有成就感。

definition: literal/word by word and phrase by phrase
to read cursorily/to skim through
to read in silence
lit. not requiring a detailed understanding (idiom); only looking for an overview/not bothered with the details/superficial/content with shallow understanding
lit. always with a book in hand (idiom)/fig. (of a student or scholar) diligent and hardworking
speed reading
extensive reading
to swallow in one gulp (idiom)/(fig.) to accept without thinking/to lap up
have wide learning and a retentive memory/have encyclopedic knowledge
to know by heart (so well that you can recite it backwards)
to annotate/to add marginal comments on/criticism/marginalia
to copy/to transcribe
to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
to have a highly retentive memory/to have sth imprinted in one's memory
word for word/verbatim
to finish (a letter, a painting) at a stroke
